title.narrative: People Oriented Urban Public Space Programme For China

description.narrative: (EA1). Enhanced national policy on public space planning and design, impacting on improved public spaces in China.(EA2). Demonstrations on improved public spaces with city partners. Advisory services and planning and design for particular public space issues, at neighbourhood, ward or city level.

participating-org.narrative: CHANGSHA KAIFU SHANTY TOWN REGENERATION INVESTMENT CO LTD
WUHAN LAND USE AND SPATIAL PLANNING CENTER - CHINA
WUHAN PLANNING AND DESIGN INSTITUTE CHINA

department.narrative: Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

sector.narrative: Multisector aid for basic social services

title.narrative: Improved spatial strategies, planning and design development policies and frameworks and/or legislative guidance are piloted in public space demonstration projects in Chinese cities.

description.narrative: Improved spatial strategies, planning and design development policies and frameworks and/or legislative guidance are piloted in public space demonstration projects in Chinese cities.

title.narrative: A number of partner cities within the programme have piloted and demonstrated improved spatial strategies, planning and design development policies and frameworks and/or legislative guidance for specific public space demonstration projects.

description.narrative: A number of partner cities within the programme have piloted and demonstrated improved spatial strategies, planning and design development policies and frameworks and/or legislative guidance for specific public space demonstration projects.

title.narrative: a) Policy dialogue on improved urban public spaces in China for and with national metropolitan and city authorities is established.

description.narrative: a) Policy dialogue on improved urban public spaces in China for and with national metropolitan and city authorities is established.

title.narrative: The establishment of a national dialogue is measured by means of an array of guidelines, tools, studies, recommendations and/or by-laws being adopted and published by relevant institutions, i.e. 1.Public space guidelines (MoHURD (line ministry)) 2. Public Space legislation tool (UN-Habitat China) 3.Advisory studies by national partners 4.Advisory recommendations to Chinese cities 5.City by-laws or other public space guidelines issued by participating Chinese cities
